summary: The trade of gold, tantalum, tin, and tungsten helps finance violent conflict in the eastern region of the Democratic Republic of the Congo. To reduce revenue to armed groups profiting from this trade, Congress directed the Securities and Exchange Commission to require companies using these conflict minerals to disclose their origins. SEC's rule requiring the disclosures hasn't reduced violence. Armed groups continue to fight for...
title: Conflict Minerals: Peace and Security in Democratic Republic of the Congo Have Not Improved with SEC Disclosure Rule
